availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles A. Bourland (Hopkins County farmer and later a doctor)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Patience Bourland. Married to Eudora Hays Bourland. Worked in the dry goods business in the early 1860s. Farm laborer in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville: F. A. Battey and Company, 1887), 898.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 119.
Find A Grave, "Dr. Charles Adolphus Bourland (March 31, 1845-July 12, 1926)," Memorial #112483460, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112483460 (accessed March 24, 2017).
